channel.title: Webclient HTMl only works on my pc
channel.description: Hello there everyone, I jarred and signed my webclient and put it in an html etc, now I can run it with my index.html and it connects fine, now when I upload to 000webhost, It loads, but I can't connect. What to do?

item.title: Webclient HTMl only works on my pc
item.dc:creator: @artego artego
item.description:
@artego wrote:

Noobs44:I use the free one
Zyle1992: 1: Of course I did I downloaded no-ip dns I got my router portforwarded, my normal client connects just fine.If I just start the index.html file on my pc it also works fine, even if I host it on my pc it works just fine.
2: The webclient downloads the cache just fine. I first hosted it on 000webhost but that didn’t really worked because sometimes it dropped the downloading packet if the server was too busy. Now I host it on dropbox and that works just fine.
4: yes it is, if the webclient works just fine on my pc then why wouldn’t it? And then I mean when opeing my index.html with firefox, not running the jar. Btw I sent my webclient files to my friend, He opened the index.html and could connect.

Trollpkz: That’s niot the problem, it works and downloads the cache just fine, It just can’t connect if hosted on 000webhost.com

Read full topic
item.source: Webclient HTMl only works on my pc

item.title: Webclient HTMl only works on my pc
item.dc:creator: @trollpkz trollpkz
item.description:
@trollpkz wrote:

umm u can do it on 000webhosts.com u have to upload ur client.jar (what every u called it) then go to the link of it (e.g www.trollpkz.example.com/client.jar) copy it edit ur webclient.html and where it says the .jar take that off and paste in the url ad it should work It worked for me hope it helps ;D

Read full topic
item.source: Webclient HTMl only works on my pc

item.title: Webclient HTMl only works on my pc
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

  1. Did you change the IP from 127.0.0.1 to your No-IP address?
  2. Is the server using the JAGGRAB protocol to download the cache?
  3. If the answer to #2 is no, is there at least some way for the client to download the cache?
  4. Is the cache being downloaded to the same location as it’s being loaded from?

Read full topic
item.source: Webclient HTMl only works on my pc
